Name: The Maela
Notes: Part of the Everfest Carnival, fortune tellers, seers, oracles, enchantresses, and conjurers

Name: The Valdur
Notes: Part of the Everfest Carnival, known for strongmen acts and work with animals

Name: Enion
Notes: Armory of the ancients and training ground of champions

Name: Yvor's Peak
Notes: Statue of Yvor located here, doorway to an armory

Name: Demonastery
Notes: Mansion, residents have specifc rooms, it moves, accessible by invitation

Name: Entrance Hall
Notes: Location of the portal to íArathael, Whisper the stained glass window

Name: íArathael
Notes: Separate plane, accessed via a portal in the Demonastery, home of the Old Ones

Name: The Vitiate Gateway
Notes: Last of 9 portals connecting Rathe to íArathael

Name: Mugenshi Village
Notes: Hidden, lead by Katsu, in the Mugenshi Gorge

Name: Aui's Scale Strongholds
Notes: Locations where things are concealed from the public

Name: Golden Chariot
Notes: In the city proper, inn, owned by [Minerva](../other-characters/minerva-themis.md)

Name: Library of Illumination
Notes: In the city proper, a public library, cared for by the members of the Light of Sol

Name: Ampitheatre
Notes: In the city proper, a space for ceremonies, public events and proclamations

Name: Ceremionial Chamber
Notes: In the city proper, location of the Awakening ceremony

Name: The Solarium
Notes: The inner sanctum, home to the Light of Sol

Name: The Silvaris
Notes: A series of beautiful public gardens surrounding the inner sanctum of Solana

Name: The Plazas
Notes: Connect the outer city sectors, a space to gather and hear news

Name: The Great Gates
Notes: These eight paths lead through the city to the Solarium

Name: The Golden Fields
Notes: Beyond the outer walls are grand golden fields, numerous villages and towns under the protection and guidance of Solana

Name: Blackjack's Tavern
Notes: Bounty Hunting Hub, Owned by Greenbird, "Neutral Ground"

Name: Freakshow Territory
Notes: Deep in the Pits, composed of abandoned mineshafts

Name: The Maw
Notes: Entrance to the pits, traveled by mine cage

Name: Torched Territory
Notes: Marked with trigger-sensitive flamethrowers, fire traps, lava pits, and plenty of explosives

Name: Numbskull Territory
Notes: Cave network lined with skulls, resembles a catacomb

Name: Jawbreaker Territory
Notes: No official territory with the exception of some houses on the water

Name: Blockhead Territory
Notes: An entire sector of The Maw

Name: The Oasis
Notes: Water from Misteria, lava from Mt. Volcor

Name: Ankomeido
Notes: Home to the misfits and malcontents of Misteria

Name: Iron Hall
Notes: The seat of power for Metrix's municipal government

Name: Eighth Precinct
Notes: Enforcer station, down the street from the Iron Hall

Name: Mistcloak Lake
Mentions: [Part 1: The Tiger in the Mist](../main-story/15-part-the-mistveil/part-1-the-tiger-in-the-mist.md), [Part 2: The Tapestry Unfolds](../main-story/15-part-the-mistveil/part-2-the-tapestry-unfolds)

Name: Nasu-ka Teahouse
Mentions: [Nuu, Alluring Desire](../heroes-of-rathe/nuu-about.md), [Part 1: The Tiger in the Mist](../main-story/15-part-the-mistveil/part-1-the-tiger-in-the-mist.md), [Part 2: The Tapestry Unfolds](../main-story/15-part-the-mistveil/part-2-the-tapestry-unfolds), [Part 3: The Serpent's Strike](../main-story/15-part-the-mistveil/part-3-the-serpents-strike.md)

Name: Candlelight Clearing
Notes: Where the Rosetta of old had once gathered to garden, share poetry, and sing

Name: Deshavan
Mentions: [Mark of a Traitor](../main-story/17-the-hunted/mark-of-a-traitor.md),[Cleanse the Corruption](../main-story/17-the-hunted/cleanse-the-corruption.md),[Hunter and Hunted Both](../main-story/17-the-hunted/hunter-and-hunted-both.md),[Children of Chaos](../main-story/17-the-hunted/children-of-chaos.md)
